project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Agile's Release Burndown documentation, there is an additional information regarding some of the Sprint behaviour like below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-release-burndown

{panel}*In the 'Completed Issues' table, why are some issues grouped into sprints that they are not assigned to?*

In the 'Completed Issues' table, an issue is grouped into a sprint if its completion date falls after the start date of the sprint and before the start date of the next sprint, regardless of whether it was assigned to the sprint during planning.

For example, consider the following sample data:
* Sprint 1 — starts on July 1 and ends on July 14
* Sprint 2 — starts on July 17 and ends on July 30

Say issue 'ABC-123' was assigned to Sprint 1 during planning but was not completed until July 18. In the 'Completed Issues' table, ABC-123 would be grouped under Sprint 2, rather than Sprint 1. This is a more accurate reflection of what happened during the release and helps maintain the integrity of the report data.
{panel}

However, this part of the documentation is missing from JIRA Software 7.0 onwards 
 documentation:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/release-burndown-861254693.html


h3. Suggested Solution

Add the following part to the JIRA Software Release Burndown documentation:

{panel}*In the 'Completed Issues' table, why are some issues grouped into sprints that they are not assigned to?*

In the 'Completed Issues' table, an issue is grouped into a sprint if its completion date falls after the start date of the sprint and before the start date of the next sprint, regardless of whether it was assigned to the sprint during planning.

For example, consider the following sample data:
* Sprint 1 — starts on July 1 and ends on July 14
* Sprint 2 — starts on July 17 and ends on July 30

Say issue 'ABC-123' was assigned to Sprint 1 during planning but was not completed until July 18. In the 'Completed Issues' table, ABC-123 would be grouped under Sprint 2, rather than Sprint 1. This is a more accurate reflection of what happened during the release and helps maintain the integrity of the report data.
{panel}
fields.summary: Release Burndown missing documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Trying to attach a file from the *Quick Operations* view after selecting an issue on a sprint fails.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.6 and 7.3.7
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to an Agile dashboard
 # Browse to an open sprint (or the backlog)
 # Select/highlight an issue (via mouse click or J/K shortcuts)
 # Press "." on the keyboard to bring up the Quick Operations screen for that issue.
 # Type in "attach" to select *Attach Files*
 # Select a file you want to attach
 # Click "open" to attach the file

h3. Expected Results

You are able to attach a file successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The following exception is thrown in the UI:

!Screen Shot 2017-07-26 at 10.41.17 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Attach files from inside the issue view instead of Quick Operations.
fields.summary: Trying to attach a file from the *Quick Operations* view after selecting an issue on a sprint fails.

fields.description:
Hi Tech. Support

In the KB article https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2014-808761244.html , it is mentioned that the JIRA DB needs to be "accent-insensitive".


Can we deploy an "accent-insensitive" JIRA DB to run on an "accent-sensitive" SQL Server platform (e.g., Our SQL server uses the default "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" collation), and still be supported by Atlassian?

Pls. send your reply to [kenchow@deloitte.ca.|mailto:kenchow@deloitte.ca.]  Thanks.

Ken
416 202 2688
fields.summary: An "Accent-insensitive" JIRA DB to Run on An "Accent-sensitive" SQL Server Platform

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user deletes a Sprint, the issues in Sprint will automatically moved to next Sprint and if there's no other Sprint, it'll be moved to backlog.

User would like JIRA to give a pop up warning informing other users to move the issues to another Sprint or backlog before the Sprint is deleted.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add pop up a warning like:

{quote}
Are you sure you want to delete sprint "Sprint Name". Move the issues to appropriate Sprint or Backlog before deleting the Sprint
{quote}

To inform users to move issues out of the Sprint before deleting it.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Show warning to move issues before deleting Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The word "commitment" is too present in JIRA. This word represents one of the Scrum values since the last update of the Scrum Guide in July 2016.

It does not represent the objective of the Developement Team anymore and has been replaced since the 2011 version by the term "forecast": "The Development Team works to forecast the functionality that will be developed during the Sprint." The Development Team does not commit to an amount a stories, it forecasts by doing its best every day.

See the revisions of the Scrum Guide here: http://scrumguides.org/revisions.html

Wording is very important and mixing the terms disturb the comprehension that we have about things. Commitment is really an important word and by replacing it by forecast, we help all teams in the world understanding what it means to forecast a Sprint during the Sprint Planning!

Please note that the term is especially visible in the Velocity chart.

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: Replace "commitment" by "forecast" in JIRA Agile

fields.description:
Hi,

the quick filters are nice, but with a larger team and many issues the possibilities are too limited.

E.g. when you have a team of 10 ppl. you would need a quick filter for each of those alone and generate 10 quick filters (no you can't always use "current user" because in a daily standup situation the scrum master wants to filter the board for a specific team member and not only for his own issues).

It would also open up the possibility to structure large backlogs a bit better by creating custom fields with term lists that would only use up one quickfilter slot where I can select the value that I need.
fields.summary: Quick filter should get value picker for larger term lists

Version: 7.1.8

Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If an Epic is moved to another project and simultaneous changed to another issue type, existing Stories linked to this Epic is not removed.
* This then affects JQL queries results.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a scrum project
* Create an Epic (let's say this is SSP-20)
* Add a Story to this Epic
* Confirm the JQL query:
{code}
"Epic Link" = SSP-20
{code}
** Note the Story is returned
* Move the Epic, SSP-20 to another project and change the issue type to a non-Epic

h5. Expected Behaviour
As SSP-20 is no longer an Epic and moved to another project, all existing Epic links should be removed.

h5. Actual Behaviour
* Notice that the UI no longer displays any Epic links
* JQL search continues to show that the Epic link exists:
{code}
"Epic Link" = SSP-20
{code}
* Check the database {{issuelink}} table and notice that the link exists in the database

h5. Workaround
* Manually remove the link from the database
* Perform a project re-index
fields.summary: Moving an Epic to another Project and changing the Issue Type does not Remove Linked Stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a Scrum or Kanban board's Backlog or Active Sprints, you can click an issue to bring up the detail view in the right-hand column. In JIRA 7.2.0 and above, hovering over the section headers (*Details*, *People*, *Dates*, *Description*, *Comments*, *Attachments*, and *Sub-Tasks*) reveals a collapse/expand button that does not function (Screenshot 1). You're only able to expand and collapse sections via the navigation panel at left.

!Screenshot 1.png|thumbnail!

In JIRA 7.1.10 and below, these collapse/expand buttons do not appear when hovering over section titles.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2.0 and above.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install any JIRA >= 7.2.0
 # Add a sample project and board
 # View the board's Backlog or Active sprints and click an issue.
 # Hover over a section header in the right-hand pane.

h3. Expected Results

Since collapse/expand buttons appear, they should function as such.
h3. Actual Results

Collapse/expand buttons appear on hover-over but do not function.
h3. Notes

This provides for very confusing UI. Everywhere else in the interface, these expand/collapse buttons function as expected.
fields.summary: Collapse/Expand toggles not functional in Board Detail View

h3. +Summary+

(!) In the doc of [Using AppLinks to link to other applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/using-applinks-to-link-to-other-applications-881683245.html], the following link no longer exists:
* [Making a primary link for links to the same application type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/applinks/application-links-user-guide/making-a-primary-link-for-links-to-the-same-application-type]

The last existing link is for Applinks 4.3:
* [Making a primary link for links to the same application type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS043/Making+a+primary+link+for+links+to+the+same+application+type]

If we manually change the above URL to (remove 043 to make it the latest Applinks version):

It will be redirected to this unrelated doc:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

If JIRA is linked with more than 1 Bamboo instance and an issue has links to Plan Branches from multiple Bamboo, JIRA is only able to retrieve and display the link from the Primary Bamboo.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Create an applinks between JIRA and 2 different Bamboo instances
 # Create a Plan Branch in each Bamboo instance that is linked to a single JIRA issue
 # View the JIRA issue's Issue Links section

h3. +Expected behavior+

JIRA is able to retrieve and display the 2 links properly.
h3. +Actual behavior+

JIRA is only able to retrieve and display the link from the Primary Bamboo. It fails to load the link from the Non-Primary one:

!link.png|thumbnail!

From JIRA log, the following message is seen:
{code:java}
2017-07-22 19:54:15,471 http-nio-8740-exec-3 WARN admin 1194x2257x1 1hycggs 10.60.2.10 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10001 [c.a.j.p.e.bamboo.view.BuildLinkRenderer] Error when fetching Bamboo Plan status for key BAM-SUB1 [Project BAM not found.]{code}
h3. +Notes+
 # The URLs of the links are correct. This means, users can actually click the "Failed to load" link to go to the respective Plan Branch (_probably the only known Workaround_).
 # JIRA however seems to use the Base URL of the Primary Bamboo to retrieve all the links' information, leading to 404 Not Found (Failed to load).

h3. +Diagnosis+

Turning on Debugging for _org.apache.http.wire_, the following log is captured:
 * For link from Primary Bamboo:

{noformat}
2017-07-22 20:08:33,962 http-nio-8740-exec-12 DEBUG admin 1208x2436x2 1hycggs 10.60.2.10 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10002 [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-174 >> "Host: 192.168.1.100:9003[\r][\n]"
...
2017-07-22 20:08:33,992 http-nio-8740-exec-12 DEBUG admin 1208x2436x2 1hycggs 10.60.2.10 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10002 [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-174 << "HTTP/1.1 200 OK[\r][\n]"{noformat}
 * For link from Non-Primary Bamboo:

{noformat}
2017-07-22 20:08:33,964 http-nio-8740-exec-14 DEBUG admin 1208x2435x1 1hycggs 10.60.2.10 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10001 [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-175 >> "Host: 192.168.1.100:9003[\r][\n]"
...
2017-07-22 20:08:34,014 http-nio-8740-exec-14 DEBUG admin 1208x2435x1 1hycggs 10.60.2.10 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10001 [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-175 << "HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found[\r][\n]"{noformat}
(!) Apparently, JIRA uses the same URL (192.168.1.100:9003) to retrieve the links.
fields.summary: JIRA fails to retrieve Plan Branches from Non-Primary Bamboo

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Environment
JIRA 7.3.8
Fisheye 4.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create application link between JIRA and Fisheye
2. Configure SVN repo in Fisheye
3. Add Fisheye Chart gadget to JIRA dashboard
4. Configure it to only show "Line of Code" metrics for a specific file type. Ex. Only show line changes for Javascript files by entering _js_ in File Extension(s) field

 

h3. Expected Results
The chart will only show line of code metrics for that specific file type


h3. Actual Results
The chart doesn't filter by any file extension and returns all changes.


h3. Notes
On the surface it appears that the Fisheye gadget is not interpreting the data received from Fisheye properly. This is based on the fact that if we run a line of code report in Fisheye, we see the expected results.

h3.Workaround

No current workaround.
fields.summary: Fisheye Chart gadget for JIRA does not filter results based on values in the 'File Extension(s)' field

 !Page-Shot-2017-7-20 PROJ board - Agile Board - Your Company JIRA.png|width=387,height=292!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
#1 : As System Administrator, Administrator or Project administrator, I want to see on a project summary all informations about the sharing of the schemes and their items.

#2 : From the version 7.3 a workflow shared by 1 project means shared by 1 project in addition of the current project, but this is not the case of all other items, e.g. an Issue type scheme need to be edited to be able to see that it is shared by 2 projects, and that means the current project and another, etc.

As System Administrator, Administrator or Project administrator, I want
 * to see "not shared" when an item is not shared,
 * and "shared by X projects" when X projects are involved, even if I am on one project view (as on version 7.2 and before).

Could you provide always the same thing to the administrators ?
fields.summary: Shared objects: Wording uniformisation between Workflows, SS, ITS, etc.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When sub-task is transitioned to completed status in issue page & the completed status is not mapped in right most column in column configuration and a user tries to complete the Sprint, JIRA will show an error saying that the Sprint cannot be completed because sub-task is incomplete. 

In some cases, user would like to have a status like "cancelled" for sub-task in issue page but not on board because they would like to prevent accidental cancellation. 


h3. Suggested Solution

Add function JIRA to ignore sub-tasks in specific status while completing Sprint.


h3. Workaround 

Map the completed status to the most right column in column configuration.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to complete Sprint when completed sub-tasks status is not mapped in Column configuration

We have a use case of JIRA and we don't know how to make it easy to use.

As a Jira-User
I want to create a parent issue if it's not available
while creating a subissue.

 

**Example**: The application process

Person: Parent Issue
Application: Child / Sub Issue

While creating the application issue we notice that the person is not available.
Via link issue (or similar) we want to create the needed person and link both tickets.
Actual we need to create 2 tickets and link them manually.

!Jira_question.png!

Is a plugin available?
Can this be included in Jira?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In a JIRA Project Board it is possible to receive the following misleading message even when there is an active sprint:

{code:java}
There are no active sprints
Start sprints in the Backlog
{code}

There is a scenario where the sprint would not show up when *all issues* in the sprint do *not* have their statuses mapped. If at least one issue has statuses mapped the sprint will show up.

Instead of the misleading message _There are no active sprints_, JIRA could display a message such as:

_There is (are) issue(s) in the sprint but there are no statuses mapped for those issue(s)._

The Cause/Resolution for the issue is documented in the following Atllassian KB, 4th line:

[Issues are not appearing in Boards |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/issues-are-not-appearing-in-boards-779159013.html]

Although this is documented, it is not clear for the end user why the sprint is not showing up, when there is one active and is not yet completed.
fields.summary: Refine generic misleading message There are no active sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever setting the Estimate Field in JIRA to a value higher than 2147483647 such as 2147483648, the Estimate field will go into a negative value when the issue is placed in the Sprint column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Test Project
# Create a Test Issue 
# Enable the *Story Points* Estimation Statistic under *Board > Configure > Estimation*
# Edit the Estimate Field and insert 2147483648 into the field.

h3. Expected Results

The value shows as normal.

h3. Actual Results

The value goes into a negative value.

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-10 at 5.59.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use any value that is 2147483647 or lower for this field.
fields.summary: Whenever configuring the Story Points Estimate Field, any value larger than 2147483647 will cause the field to go into a negative value.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem
When loading *any* board's "Configure" page, it can take an extremely long time when JIRA has a lot of custom fields. This looks to be regardless of the board configuration

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an Agile Board
* Add 4000+ fields to JIRA
** This can be done via the Data Generator: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-data-generator/server/overview
* Load the board's "Configuration" page

h5. Expected Results
* Configuration page loads within a reasonable time

h5. Actual Results
* Any board's configuration page takes an extremely long time, 20s+

A  Jprofiler snapshot, [^board_configure.jps], is attached and we noticed that {{FieldSelectorResult.accept}} take most of the time to process.
fields.summary: Having a Large Amount of Custom Fields Causes Long Load Times for Board Configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you have enable the Kanplan Dark feature to test the feature in JIRA 7.3.X and upgrade to 7.4.0 while the darkfeature is enabled the Kanban backlog feature will fail to install.

Instruction to enable experimental dark feature visible to public in various locations i.e.:
* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/JIRA-questions/jira-kanban-backlog-on-server/qaq-p/154388

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.3.X Upgrading to 7.4.0+
* {{com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.kanplan}} set to Enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install jira 7.3.x
* Navigate to *BASE_ULR/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa*
* Enable *com.atlassian.jira.agile.darkfeature.kanplan*
* Upgrade to 7.4.0
* [Attempt to Enable the backlog as covered here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver074/leading-an-agile-project/starting-a-new-project/configuring-a-project/configuring-a-board/configuring-columns#Configuringcolumns-enablingkanbanbacklogEnablingtheKanbanbacklog]

h3. Expected Results
Enable backlog option is available

h3. Actual Results
The option to enable kanban backlog is missing, and cannot be enabled
 
h3.Workaround
Disable the dark feature before upgrading

OR [Roll Back To 7.3 | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/rolling-back-a-jira-application-upgrade-881683276.html] and then disable the dark feature and re-upgrade to 7.4.0
fields.summary: Kanban backlog Fails to install during upgrade when dark feature is enabled

fields.description:
Dear Support-Team,

our productive Confluence version at this time is 5.1.1 .

We plan to upgrade, renew and expand licences for an new Confluence
installation. Fore this we use Version 6.0.6 at the moment in our Test-System.

I think, we should upgrade the 6.0.6 Version , before we switch soon to the new 
installation as productive Confluence.

Do you recommend a special Release ore should I upgrade to the last Version 6.2.3?

I talked with our Security Manager , he said that he generally trust the security activities
of your company. I should ask you, if you carry out security checks in 
your releases? Is it possible that you let me know, which security activities do you perform,
if they do not secret? Are there results of security checks?

What Relese Version do you recommend if I have an eye to security requirements?

Best Regaeds
Juergen Schaefer
fields.summary: What Relese Version do you recommend if I have an eye to security requirements?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

All Agile report showing incorrect estimate when switching to the French language. The problem only happens when the board is estimated using Story Points option.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create some issues without estimation in a scrum project.
# Add them to a sprint.
# Start sprint
# Add story point to the newly created issue.
# Complete the Sprint.
# Open the Sprint Report or Burndown Chart


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.1, 7.3.8


h3. Expected Results

All the Agile reports show the correct Story points estimates after switching to the French language.


h3. Actual Results

All the Agile reports do not show any Story points estimates after switching to the French language. 


h3.Workaround

Switch to another language like English
fields.summary: Story Points not detected while using JIRA with French language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Import from Trac fails to handle Trac tickets.
Jira creates a user named ‘anonymous’ for Trac tickets, which have no owner set.
Clearly, no user should be created and ticket should be unassigned in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Trac create tickets with no owner (unassigned)
# Import trac to JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira creates a ticket, and correctly leaves it unassigned.


h3. Actual Results
JIRA creates a user anonymous and assigns the ticket to that user.

h3.Workaround
* remove the wrong user manually.
fields.summary: Jira creates a user named ‘anonymous’ for Trac tickets, which have no owner set.

h2. Starting a sprint Section

 _If you haven't estimated your issues,_ _you will receive a warning when starting the sprint (unless you are using Issue Count, as this is calculated automatically)._

I'm not sure if there are any other sections that are impacted by this.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Apparently, when clicking the "View Workflow" button from the Issue Detail Panel after clicking an issue will redirect users to the Standard Issue Detail View instead of the usual Pop-up window where we could see the Issue/Ticket workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Navigate to any Board(Scrum or Kanban)
# Click any issue to show the Issue Detail View Panel on the right.
# On the panel, click the "View Workflow"

h3. Expected Result:
* A Pop-up will appear to show the Issue Workflow.

h3. Actual Result:
* The page will be redirected to Issue Detail View of the selected Issue, still not showing the workflow until the "View Workflow" link is clicked again there.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Import from Trac fails to handle Trac tickets with multiple owners or reporters.
Trac allows tickets to be owned or reported by multiple users.
JIRA importer fails to handle those tickets

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Trac create tickets with multiple owners.
database shout look like this:
Here's an example SQL query (select owner, reporter from ticket) from TRAC database:
owner | reporter
----------------------------------------+----------
user1, user2, user3 | user4
# Import trac to JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA should create the corresponding ticket and have the ticket assignee set to user1.
* user2 and user3 should be created.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA creates a user as "user1, user2, user3" and have him assigned to the ticket.

h3.Workaround
* remove the wrong user manually and recreate the users manually.
fields.summary: JIRA Import from Trac fails to handle Trac tickets with multiple owners or reporters

h3. Suggested Solution

Add detail of Remaining Estimate similar to what's shown for Original Estimate in Epic Report and also the percentage of issues completed in Epic.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Add Remaining Estimate and completed percentage in Reports

fields.description:
h3. To encourage standardization and adoption, it would be great if Jira can automatically create the following tasks each a new Master Project or a Story is created:
# Default Tasks to be created for a Master Project
* IssueType: "Pre-Project", Summary: "Pre-Project for "+ <Master Project Name>, Components: <Inherited from Master Project>, Linked Issues: "is contained in", Issue: <Master Project>
* IssueType: "Project Management Task", Summary: "Project Management for "+ <Master Project Name>, Components: <Inherited from Master Project>, Linked Issues: "is contained in", Issue: <Master Project>
* IssueType: "Project Meeting Task", Summary: "Meetings for "+ <Master Project Name>, Components: <Inherited from Master Project>, Linked Issues: "is contained in", Issue: <Master Project>
# Default Sub-Tasks to be created for a Story
* IssueType: "Requirements", Summary: "Requirements for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "Analysis", Summary: "Analysis for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "Development", Summary: "Development for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "QATP Task", Summary: "QATP for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "QA Testing", Summary: "QA Testing for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "Development", Summary: "Dev Testing for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>
* IssueType: "Development", Summary: "Dev Support to QA for "+ <Story Name>, Components: <Inherited from Story>

Could you please explore the options and let me know? This will go a long way in addressing some of the Jira/Agile adoption hurdles for our teams.
fields.summary: To encourage standardization and adoption, it would be great if Jira can automatically create the following tasks each a new Master Project or a Story is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Cannot read property 'id'" error is thrown in Board when user edit issues where some of the field is set as required. (Eg: Reporter).

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to Field Configuration page and set Reporter as required.
# Open any board, click on any issue from Swimlane view and click on Edit button.
# Add any comment and save the changes.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.8, JIRA 7.3.4


h3. Expected Results

JIRA edit the issue without any Javascript error.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA throws the "Cannot read property 'id'" error since the Reporter field is not shown in the board's Edit screen.


h3.Workaround

Go to field configuration page and set the system field like Reporter as "Optional".
fields.summary: "Cannot read property 'id'" error while editing issue from Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating issue with Priority field hidden in either *Field Configuration* or the Priority field is removed from issue type's screen will cause "-1" Priority to appear in Agile board's card colour priority option. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Select JIRA (Software) Project.
# Access (Board -> Configure -> Card color) and choose card color option "Priority".
# Access the Field Configuration used by the newly created project and *hide* the Priority field
# Create an issue in the JIRA project
# Access the newly created the board where the issue is on. Open (Board -> Configure -> Card color) and the "-1" priority -1 will be shown


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.0, JIRA 7.3.8


h3. Expected Results

When issues are created with no Priority field entry, "-1" priority is not added to the Card color page.


h3. Actual Results

When issues are created with no Priority field entry, "-1" priority is added to the Card color page.


h3.Workaround

User can potentially add a default priority from workflow post-function
fields.summary: "-1" Priority in Agile board's card colours Priority option

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachment links is not showing after clicking at the attachment icon from "Add flag and comment" pop up dialog. For example:

!problem.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.8
 * Chrome, Firefox and IE 11 browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1*
 # Open any Agile board.
 # Click on any issue to display the issue details at the right of the screen.
 # Attach a file.
 # Click on {{...}} button and select "Add flag and comment" button.
 # Click Attachment icon.

*Scenario 2*
# Edit Comment from the issue detail at the right of the screen.
# Click Attachment icon.
# You can't see the list of the attachment links

*Scenario 3 (in Firefox)*
# Click Comment from issue screen.
# Click Browse and select a file, we will see the attachment icon broken:
!browse.png|thumbnail!
!Add-file-after-click-browse.png|thumbnail!
# It doesn't happen after added the comment.
!after-add-comment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should display any attachment links after click on the attachment icon.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA is not display anything after clicking the attachment icon.
h3. Notes

The reason why user attach a file at first is due to the Edit Comment does not show the Browse option in the Attachment Option bug.
h3. Workaround

Link the attachment in the comment by using our [attachment text formatting|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=attachments] via Text mode:
{code}
!attachment.png!
!attachment.png|thumbnail!
{code}
fields.summary: Attachment icon function is broken

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When removing the last story from a sprint, prompt user to delete sprint


h3. Suggested Solution
Have JIRA check for when number of issues assigned to a sprint goes from 1+ down to 0, if this happens when removing an issue from a sprint, prompt the user to delete the sprint entirely



h3. Why this is important
In the process of planning sprints, sometimes you have to delete a sprint in the planning stages that will never be started.   However right now within JIRA, the only want to do so are either to make a REST call, or to delete the sprint on the origin board where it was created.

This can be a problem for environments that heavily rely on the use of the project restoration method in order to move projects between JIRA instances.  Since the project restore does not include the board information, that sprint does not always appear on the newly created board in the destination instance.  But all the issues freshly imported there are still referencing this old sprint value.   If you create a new sprint on the system with the same name, you have just made this process more complicated



h3. Workaround 
Give each sprint a uniquely different name, and use the bulk change feature in JIRA to update all the issues with the previous sprint name to use the new sprint name.
fields.summary: When removing the last story from a sprint, prompt user to delete that sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

In Microsoft Internet Explorer 11, on the *Boards* » <Board> » *Issues* page, there is a Quick Issue Create input box under the list of Issues. The international keyboard is not correctly converting characters properly on this text input.

It works in other Text Input boxes in JIRA.

h4. How to reproduce

# On Microsoft Windows 7
# *Control Panel* » *Change keyboards or other input methods*
#* On the *Keyboards and Languages tab*, click Change *Keyboards*
#** On the *General Tab*, Click *Add*
#*** Select *Korean (Korea)* » *Microsoft IME* and click OK
#** On the *Language Bar tab*
#*** Select *Floating on Desktop*
#*** Tick "Show additional Language bar icons in the taskbar"
#*** Tick Show text labels on the Language bar
#*** Click OK
# Open up JIRA in Internet Explorer
#* Go to *Boards* » <Board> » *Issues* (on the left menu)
#** Change the Windows Floating Language Bar to:
#*** KO Korean (Korean) Microsoft IME and select *Han/Eng*
#** Click into the *Create Issue* on the bottom
#*** Enter the letters T and Y

h4. Expected Result

A single Korean character should appear.

 !Chrome.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual Result

Two individual Korean characters appear.

 !IE.png|thumbnail! 

h4.Workaround

# Create the issue through the top *Create Issues* button; or
# Use Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: International keyboard is not supported on Boards - Issues Quick Create in IE

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Removing  or disabling an LDAP directory that contains a group that has been added as board administrator breaks 'View Board' function. This is also applied to internal group which is deleted but remains listed as Board admin. When user tried to open View Board after removing LDAP, following stack trace will be thrown in log:
{code:java}
2017-06-23 17:06:09,622 http-nio-8738-exec-4 ERROR charlie 1026x1848x3 3l148v 127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildBoardAdminsFromView(RapidViewListHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListEntry(RapidViewListHelper.java:207)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListAndConfigModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource$2.call(RapidViewListResource.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource$2.call(RapidViewListResource.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel(RapidViewListResource.java:74)
{code}
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a group in LDAP or create an internal group in JIRA.
 # Add the LDAP in JIRA.
 # Open board configuration page of any board and add the group name to the "Board Administrator".
 # Remove the LDAP from JIRA or delete the internal group
 # Open "View Boards" again.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.3.7, JIRA 7.3.8, Jira 7.4.2

h3. Expected Results
View Boards shows all the boards available in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results
View Boards does not show any boards available in JIRA.

h3. Workaround
Re-enable the Crowd user directory. This has solved the issue in some cases. After doing this the directory can be disabled once again.

h3. Second workaround
 # Use the following SQL query to find the group that has been added as a Board Administrator but is not available in *cwd_group* or resides in a disabled directory: 
{code:SQL}
select distinct ba."KEY" from "AO_60DB71_BOARDADMINS" ba where ba."TYPE" = 'GROUP' and ba."KEY" not in (select group_name from cwd_group where directory_id in (select id from cwd_directory where active = 1));
{code}
(i) This query is for *MySQL* databases:
{code:SQL}
select distinct `KEY` from ao_60db71_boardadmins where TYPE = 'GROUP' and `KEY` not in (select group_name from cwd_group);{code}
 # Access <http://<Your JIRA's URL/secure/admin/user/GroupBrowser.jspa> and add the groups shown in the query above to your JIRA.
 # This will allow View Boards to display all the boards again. 
(!) User can choose to remove the affected group from the specific boards to prevent this problem from happening when LDAP is removed from JIRA again or when the internal group is deleted from JIRA.

h3. Alternate Workaround
If you are unable to re-add LDAP, you can alternatively identify the board containing the unmapped group and remove the group via the UI:
 # Use the following SQL query to find the group which is added as Board Administrator but not available in *cwd_group*.
{code:java}
select distinct ba."KEY" from "AO_60DB71_BOARDADMINS" ba where ba."TYPE" = 'GROUP' and ba."KEY" not in (select group_name from cwd_group where directory_id in (select id from cwd_directory where active = 1));
{code}
 # Use the following SQL query to identify the boards that the group has been added to as a Board Adminstrator:
{code:java}
select "NAME", "ID"  from "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" WHERE "ID" IN (select "RAPID_VIEW_ID" from "AO_60DB71_BOARDADMINS" WHERE "KEY" = '<groupnamefromquery1');{code}
(i) This query is for *MySQL* databases:
{code:sql}
select NAME, ID  from AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW WHERE ID IN (select RAPID_VIEW_ID from AO_60DB71_BOARDADMINS WHERE `KEY` = '<groupnamefromquery1');
{code}
 # Navigate to {{http:/<Your JIRA's URL>/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=<rapid_view_id from query2>&tab=filter}}
 # Hover over 'Administrators'
 # Click to edit
 # Remove the group
fields.summary: Removing or disabling a LDAP directory containing a group — or deleting an internal group added as board administrator — breaks View All Boards function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having a Group field on the Queue section of a Service Desk causes memory to slowly build up until the page is reloaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA Service Desk
# Create a new custom field of type "Group Picker(Multiple Groups)"
# Configure this field on the Queue page ( {{/projects/ISD/queues/custom/1}} )
# Leave JIRA open on that page on your browser (Internet Explorer, mostly) for a couple of hours
# You will see a spike on the memory usage of that tab

The only work around is to close and re-open the tab.
fields.summary: Memory spike while using IE and having a group custom field configured on Queue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user creates a new Kanban board based on the existing project, the board will not have the "Selected For Development" column. The columns tha twill be available are:

# Backlog
# In Progress
# Done

Which are columns generated for Scrum board.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.2, 7.3.7


h3. Expected Results

When the Kanban board is created with the existing project, JIRA creates Kanban board with 4 columns including the "Selected for Development" column.


h3. Actual Results

Kanban board is created but the "Selected for Development" column is missing which restrict users to transition issues from To Do -> In Progress -> Done columns.


h3.Workaround

Users can create the missing "Selected for Development" column manually by following steps below:

# Access Column Configuration page,
# Click on "Add Column" and name the column as "Selected for Development".
# Move the "Selected for Development" status from Backlog column to "Selected for Development" column.
fields.summary: Selected For Development column is missing after creating new Kanban board from existing project

h3. Expected Result:

h3. Actual Result:
* It did not do anything.

h3. Workaround:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When searching for an agile board, We would like to have the ability to filter boards based on : 
 * Who is a board admin 
 * Filters based on a specified user
 * Filter based on who created the board. 

From an Admin perspective, we would like to have the additional filtering for cleanup:
 * Any board that does not have an Admin (because the user is deleted or inactive) 
 * Does not have a valid filter
 * Creator is not active. 

*Justification*: 

We have over 10,000 boards,   we estimate 50% are obsolete which users have not cleaned up.   We would like to have a way for users to filter through their boards and perform maintenance. additionally,  when employees leave, we would like to be able to clean up when they leave.
fields.summary: Improve Searching for Agile Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Safari 10.1.1 Private mode, opening a Kanban gives you a QuotaExceededError

h3. Environment
Safari 10.1.1 (Private Mode)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Safari 10.1.1 in Private Mode
# Access the Kanban Board

h3. Expected Results
You should see the board without any errors. 

h3. Actual Results
You see the following error:
!boarderror.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
* Works correctly in normal mode in Safari 10.1.1 
* This is noted to work correctly in Private mode in Safari Technology Preview Release 32 (Safari 11.0, WebKit 12604.1.23.0.4)
fields.summary: In Safari 10.1.1 Private mode, opening a Kanban gives you an QuotaExceededError

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In a typical JIRA view issue screen, there are options for "Create Sub-task" and "Convert to Sub-task" in the More actions dropdown. However, it would be nice if there are options to "Create Story" or "Convert to Story"

h3. Suggested Solution

JIRA should have the option to easily allow us to "Create Story" or "Convert to Story" for an issue in the Epic Issue type.
fields.summary: JIRA should have a shortcut to "Create Story" and "Convert to Story" for the JIRA Epic Issue Types.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I may have projects where Epic creation needs some mandatory fields set in the "normal" creation screen.

With the Epic Creation on the Epic panel, there's just a few fields that cannot be customized and allows users the creation without the established rules.

Should have the option to enable/disable this on the configuration area of the board
fields.summary: as Scrum Board Owner I'd like to enable/disable the Epic creation option on Epic Panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA, when we clone a parent issues containing sub tasks, user are given the option to automatically clone the Sub Tasks as well. However in Agile(GreenHopper) when we clone an Epic, the linked Stories does not get cloned as well. 

Since the 'clone stories' option is not available at the current moment, users will have to clone the Epic and each of the linked stories manually, which can consume a lot of time. 

Hence, it will be great if we can implement the option to clone an Epic along with it's linked sub tasks as well.
fields.summary: When cloning an Epic, add the option to clone the linked Stories as well

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello,

There is no Conditions tab on the edit workflow transition screen for Create transition. There are just Validators and Post Functions tabs.

So it is not possible to set User Is In Group, User Is In Project Role restrictions.

It would be very useful if this functionality were implemented.

 

Kind regards,

    Andrey.
fields.summary: Add Conditions tab for Create issue transition

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create application link between JIRA and Bitbucket/Fisheye Server
Allow JIRA to complete start up before Bitbucket or Fisheye Server have started

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will periodically refresh the availability status of the connected Bitbucket/Fisheye Server and reestablish a connection when available.


h3. Actual Results
The cache is not refreshed automatically, and requires administrative intervention to manually refresh. Until this is done, the development panel in JIRA issues is unavailable.


h3. Notes

In an environment with a large number servers that require updates on a monthly basis(and thus system restarts), coordinating startup order isn't feasible. If the instance running JIRA is restarted prior to Bitbucket, the development panel will be unavailable to users until an administrator is able to log in and manually refresh the page. Having a periodic refresh of the cached status would drastically reduce the need for intervention.
fields.summary: JIRA should refresh capabilities cache periodically for connected Bitbucket/Fisheye instances

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I wanted to submit a suggestion but the process was way too complicated. So please process these things into issues (or up-votes for existing issues).

suggestion 1:

When I look at the board for my project, I expect that:
-clicking an issue (anywhere in its square) will highlight it so I can get some quick info ---like the view I have in the space at the right.  And it does.
I also expect that:
-clicking the *title* of the issue (which looks like a link) should take me to that issue (as a page). *But it does not*.  Clicking the link does the same thing as clicking the area around the link.

Currently, if I want to view an issue as a full page, I have to click on the issue so it appears in the tight section at the right, and then click the title there to go to the issue page.  If I actually click the link (the issue title), I want to link to the page (one-click).

 

suggestion 2:

I like to record my notes about issues in the comments as I test them. But JIRA has a pretty short log-out time, and when I get logged out my not-yet-posted message is lost.  I wish it would preserve my comment drafts when I get logged out.

 

suggestion 3:

Make it easier to give suggestions.  I had a thought about what was annoying and how easy it would be to fix it, so I just wanted to send someone a quick note letting them know about it.  But to do that I went through...
Is there anywhere on this page that allows me contact someone? no.

Somehow I got here: [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/
W|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]hat can I help you with?  --> Product suggestions  --> Go to product suggestions
(at this point I really thought I was one-click away from a simple text box)
This takes me to a [page|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa] that deals with a lot more than just product suggestions.
I see:
 * *To create a feature request:* Log in or create an account, then hit *Create* in the header."

But this page deals with pretty much everything, so I have to pick out which JIRA project is relevant (honestly I don't know if I picked the right one, to me its just "JIRA"). If I could submit suggests from within the page I used, you would know which one I used.  

Once I chose "Suggestion" I got a message saying
"Before creating a new Suggestion, please search the existing issues to see if your suggestion already exists."  I'm not sure where to view that.  I looked under "issues", for some variant of JIRA, and searched for key terms.  There are 5 pages of results, I did not read them all.

I really expected to just send a quick email that would find its way to someone who is well acquainted the the project, its system of improvement, its categories of features, etc.  That person could file away the information as a new issue with appropriate tags, or up the priority of an existing issue.  I did NOT expect that the only way to make a suggestion as a user was to go half-way to becoming that person myself. And at several steps I thought I was just one click away from a simple text box to enter a suggestion.  

I would make more suggestions if your suggestion process was a little less intimidating.
fields.summary: Process suggestions from Ivory

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As outlined in [Printing issue cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/printing-issue-cards-861254806.html], when multiple cards are selected in _Scrum backlog, Active sprints, Kanban backlog (if enabled)_, there should be an option to *Print Selected Cards*. However, it is not possible to select multiple cards if the cards are not from the same column


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a board and some issues in it
# Use _shift_ to select multiple cards from different columns.

For example: 

!select-multiple-cards.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Result

It is not possible to select multiple cards from different columns.

h3. Expected Result

You should be able to select multiple cards from different columns.

h3. Notes
We have reported a bug ticket for the documentation update:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65508
fields.summary: Unable to select multiple cards when attempting to print issue cards in multiple columns

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are repeated warnings in the log in regards to missing {{gh-agileToSoftwareTransformer}} web resource for _EditableDetailsView.soy.js_

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.2.3, 7.3.5


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla JIRA Software 
# Access the following page - <BaseURL>/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa
# Monitor the log file 

h3. Expected Results
No warning in the logs

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the _catalina.out_ or _atlassian-jira.log_ file:
{code}
~/w/a/d/j/j/logs ❯❯❯ grep gh-agileToSoftwareTransformer catalina.out
2017-05-31 09:51:41,965 http-nio-8723-exec-1 WARN anonymous 591x210x2 1ppckwf 127.0.0.1 /s/5df3db938c1adb909de30ebf58d268a4-T/ad6cjj/72005/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/30e83207447aabf946164aaf01c8339d/_/download/contextbatch/js/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid-inline-editable,-_super,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general,-gh-manage-boards/batch.js [c.a.plugin.webresource.WebResourceTransformation] Web resource transformer gh-agileToSoftwareTransformer not found for resource EditableDetailsView.soy.js, skipping
{code}
 
h3. Notes
It does not affect any functionality in the UI. The WARN seems to be a noise in the logs. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround to disable as of now.
fields.summary: Resource not found WARN in the log

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if users use board like below:

# Create a board with filter:  (project = TEST AND description is EMPTY ORDER BY Rank ASC).
# Create an Epic with description.
# Create few Stories without description.
# Choose to list the issues in board using Epic in Swimlanes option.

The stories will be shown in the backlog since those issues fulfil board filter but will not be shown in the Active Sprint view. 


h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new row in Active Sprint view named "Issues with unrelated epics" so the affected Stories will be grouped in this category.


h3. Workaround 

# User can ensure that board filter that they are using allows the board to retrieve all the issues including Epic/Stories/Sub-tasks
# Use different Swimlanes options.
fields.summary: Improve Swimlanes view using Epic option

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some situations, pull requests (PR) status shown in the Dev Panel might be incorrect and different from the actual status of the PR when seen from the other application (eg. bitbucket, github) . Soft sync does not fix this but a full sync (shift + Sync) does. However, the full sync feature
* Is not known to many users
* Takes a very long time to complete

h3. Suggestion
Provide an easier method to fix the PR status when they are incorrect
* Either check on them during a soft sync
* Or check on them when viewing the PR status directly
* Or have an additional "integrity checker" for DVCS specific features
fields.summary: Check pull request status during soft sync
